DataElement.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Flare Last Medical Examination CTMS Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Date of the onset of a flare or worsening of symptoms associated with acute Graft vs. Host Disease (AGVHD) that occurred since the last examination.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Flare Last Medical Examination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._Flare; reddening of the skin spreading outward from a focus of infection or irritation; a sudden recurrence or worsening of symptoms.__Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a physician or registered nurse, based on clinical and laboratory data, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.  2. The process by which a patient's condition is appraised or evaluated. (Taber's)_An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a physician or registered nurse, based on clinical and laboratory data, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Flare
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.:Flare; reddening of the skin spreading outward from a focus of infection or irritation; a sudden recurrence or worsening of symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.
Flare; reddening of the skin spreading outward from a focus of infection or irritation; a sudden recurrence or worsening of symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a physician or registered nurse, based on clinical and laboratory data, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.  2. The process by which a patient's condition is appraised or evaluated. (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.
An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a clinician that is based on a physical exam, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Date as required for Clinical Trials Monitoring Service submissions.  Exchange format is YYYYMMDD.  Display format is DDMMMYYYY, with the month display the first three letters of each month (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc.).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/30/17 jk Transferred context, added CSI and reg status, released per Round 5 finalization task. --- Display and exchange formats are based on CTMS reporting requirements v.3.02 and all subsequent versions of these guidelines.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated for NCI CCR clinical trial
